Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactors should work efficiently in both fuel cell and electrolysis modes in order to be considered a practical technology for the energy field.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor

Sentencas: In addition to improved performance, excellent electrode reversibility and stability for long-term operation are crucial for such reactors.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor

Sentencas: Herein, high-performance 6-channel solid oxide electrochemical reactors for reversible operation has been successfully developed using a phase-inversion and sintering method.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor

Sentencas: A unique morphology has been obtained where microchannels were formed from multiple directions and the interchangeable thickness of sponge-like region between each channel and the exterior surface.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor

Sentencas: Such micro-structured cells, which is made from commercially-available materials Ni-YSZ vertical bar YSZ vertical bar YSZ-LSM, exhibit superior performance for hydrogen (H-2) fuel cell achieving 1.62 W cm(-2) at 800 degrees C. Similarly, excellent performance for carbon dioxide (CO2) electrolysis has been demonstrated, achieving current densities up to 6.3 (3.1) A cm(-2) under 1.8 (1.5) V at 800 degrees C. To our knowledge, such high performances are one of the highest reported values for both H-2-fuel cell and CO2 electrolysis.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor

Sentencas: This outstanding performance, coupled with superior mechanical robustness, promises a long-awaited alternative to the conventional tubular counterpart that would allow miniaturized system to be commercially applied in the near future.
Titulo: High performance micro-monolithic reversible solid oxide electrochemical reactor
